newsitem.title: UK: RESEARCH ALERT - Enterprise reserves upped.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Enterprise reserves upped.

text.p: Lehman Brothers said on Friday it raised its estimates for the recoverable oil reserves in Enterprise Oil's Apennine field in southern Italy to 500 millon barrels from 315 million barrels.
It said the move followed a conversation with the company's chief executive Pierre Jungels and recent information from Italy's ENI, its partner in the field.
Lehman saw no immediate effect on the company's cash flow but said it could increase its net asset value to 750p.
The upgrade takes into consideration that the estimates for the oil reserves in place were raised from two million barrels to five to seven million barrels, Lehman said.

The current producing field would have a recovery ratio of 30 percent and even under the conservative assumption that ten percent was recovered, the new findings would imply 500 to 700 million barrels of recoverable reserves, Lehman stated.
Lehman said that even Enterprise was expecting higher net reserves, quoting Jungels as saying he would be disappointed if the new field yielded recoverable reserves of only one billion barrels.
